trans-unit.source: Leading provider of UV screen printing solutions since 2000. Trusted by manufacturers across Thailand for quality products and expert service.
Sole Distributor of Norcote International, Inc. in Thailand
Experience the future of innovation with cutting-edge UV screen printing technology and design solutions

Sonica was established in 2000 and has been a trusted leader in the UV screen printing industry. We are the sole distributor of Norcote International, Inc. in Thailand, bringing world-class UV screen printing solutions to manufacturers across the country.

We specialize in providing high-quality UV screen printing inks, premium squeegees, advanced LED/UV curing systems, and precision UV intensity meters. Our commitment to excellence and innovation, combined with our exclusive partnership with Norcote International, has made us a preferred partner for leading manufacturers across Thailand.

For over 40 years, Norcote has focused on developing innovative, market-driven UV curable printing inks, helping our customers lead their markets. As your needs evolve, we evolve with you, ensuring our products remain cutting-edge.

Whether you're new to UV printing or a seasoned veteran, our Technical Service team is here to provide the right tools and support, from laboratory testing to on-site troubleshooting, ensuring your projects are completed successfully.

Our team of color experts offers quick and precise color matching, and provides on-site training with the latest color measurement technology. Additionally, our friendly Customer Service Representatives ensure your orders are handled efficiently and delivered promptly, meeting your expectations every time.
Premium quality inks for various printing applications with excellent color matching capabilities.
Professional color matching to ensure perfect color consistency for your projects.
Expert guidance to optimize your printing processes and improve efficiency.
State-of-the-art LED/UV curing systems and UV intensity meters for quality control.
Extensive industry knowledge and expertise since 2000
Premium materials trusted by leading manufacturers
Comprehensive technical consulting and customer service
Cutting-edge technology and solutions for modern printing needs
Sold by weight. KG in part code indicates kg per US gallon container.
¹ May not be suitable for lightfast applications. Prolonged exposure to direct sunlight not recommended.
² Avoid using in color matches; these colors contain multiple pigments.
Transparent inks have a shelf life of 1 year from date of manufacture when stored under proper conditions.
Textured clears have a shelf life of 1 year from date of manufacture when stored under proper conditions.
May not be suitable for lightfast applications. Prolonged exposure to direct sunlight not recommended.
Avoid using in color matches; these colors contain multiple pigments.

Halogen free per the International Electrotechnical Commission standard IEC 61249-2-21, or may not be suitable for lightfast applications and is not recommended for prolonged exposure to direct sunlight.
One-part, dual cure UV/LED screen ink for glass and plastic containers. High adhesion, chemical and water resistance.
One-part UV screen ink for containers. Chemical resistant, quick curing, superb gloss, high definition. No additives required; excellent intercoat. All colors intermixable.
High-end UV curable second surface ink for industrial graphics. Extremely flexible, embossable, excellent adhesion. For user interface overlays, nameplates, automotive.
UV curable ink system for pressure sensitive decals with 3–5 years exterior exposure. Excellent flexibility, adhesion, opacity; NVP free. For pressure sensitive vinyls and print treated polyesters.
Specialty UV screen inks for decorative, metallic, and effect applications. Contact us for availability.

The 70G Series is a one-part, dual cure ink system formulated to meet the requirements needed for printing on glass and plastic bottles commonly used in the container market. It can be cured with UV or LED systems (365–405 nm) or with traditional UV mercury or iron-doped curing systems. Cross-linking continues for up to 24 hours after printing; adhesion should be tested after cooling to room temperature.
Dual cure: UV and LED (365–405 nm)
Plain weave polyester mesh 305+ TPI (120+ threads/cm) recommended
70G-070 Thinner up to 10% by weight if needed
Additives available for difficult adhesion (70G-000KG4, CUR-800, ADC-172, ADH-067, DK-072)
Metallic pastes and pigments supported (70G-000KG4 Mixing Base)
Sold by weight; KG in part code = kg per US gallon container

The PPC Series is a one-part UV curable ink system designed for direct printing on common container applications. Suitable for treated HDPE, LDPE, polypropylene, styrene, PET, and PVC. PET may require flame treatment for adhesion; for thin-walled PVC, embrittlement can occur (04 Series may be better for PVC). Inks are supplied at print-ready viscosity; PPC-070 Thinner or PPC-049 Overprint Clear can be used to thin. Curing: UV light 280–400 nm; fast cure with one 300 W/in or two 200 W/in medium pressure mercury vapor lamps. Non-visual post-curing with cross-linking up to 24 hours. All PPC Series colors are intermixable. Custom and specific colors can be matched at Norcote with print sample, wet ink sample, or Pantone® numbers.
Chemical resistant; quick curing; superb gloss; high definition
Mesh: 355 TPI and higher (140/cm²) low elongation monofilament polyester; tension 18–25 N/cm²
Stencil: direct emulsions and thin capillary films (15–25 µm)
Squeegee: sharp 80 shore durometer polyurethane preferred (60–90 or dual durometer)
Coverage: approximately 2,500 sq ft per gallon
PPC-000 Mixing Base for metallics/fluorescent; add into pigmented ink only (reactive to light)
Fluorescent colors and T-Powders available on request
Screen cleaning: conventional solvent; avoid alcohol. Norcote Press Wash 110, 140, or NSW-824
Standard warranty: 1 year from date of sale (no additives); see bulletin for custom colors and limitations

The MSK Series is a high-end, UV curable, second surface ink system specifically formulated for use on substrates common to the industrial graphics market, such as polycarbonate, print treated polyesters, and PC/PET blends. Suitable for demanding applications where adhesive resistance, opacity, embossability, and actuation resistance are required, such as user interface overlays, nameplates, and automotive applications. MSK Series inks cure only when exposed to UV light of the proper wavelength. Curing speeds depend on ink film thickness and lamp energy level; ink should be cured immediately after printing. Works best with two 200 wpi focused medium pressure mercury vapor lamps. MSK is a non-visual post-curing system with further cross-linking occurring up to 24 hours later. Custom and specific colors can be matched at Norcote with customer-supplied print sample, wet ink sample, Pantone® numbers, or other recognized standards.
Mesh: 355 TPI (140/cm²) and above for single lamp; 280 TPI (110/cm²) for two lamp systems
Stencil: direct or capillary emulsions, UV compatible, 7–10 µm dry thickness
Squeegee: 80 durometer molded preferred; 70–90 or multi-durometer polyurethane
Coverage: approximately 2,200–3,200 sq ft per gallon (0.40–0.60 mil film deposit)
Cure: two 200 wpi focused medium pressure mercury vapor lamps; 200 mJ/cm² @ 600 mW/cm² for most colors; 300 mJ/cm² @ 600+ mW/cm² for opaque colors and metallics
Thinner: up to 10% MSK-070 Thinner or 5–10% MSK-049 Mixing Clear
MSK-000 Metallic Mixing Clear for metallics; increases viscosity to stabilize pigment suspension
Not weatherable for first surface outdoor; can be used for second surface outdoor where protected
Screen cleaning: conventional solvent; avoid alcohol. Norcote Press Wash 110, 140, or NSW-824
Fluorescent colors available on request (not light-fast beyond 60–90 days); 230–260 mesh recommended
ODMSK-2586-A2 Light-block Ink available (mesh 355.34 pw, two 300 wpi medium pressure mercury lamps)
Standard warranty: 1 year from date of sale (no additives); see bulletin for custom colors and limitations

The 1500 is a UV curable ink system specifically formulated for pressure sensitive decal applications requiring exterior exposure up to five years. 1500 Series inks provide excellent flexibility, eliminating edge curl due to ink film shrinkage, as well as outstanding adhesion properties while being NVP free. Combined with automotive grade pigments, Norcote's 1500 Series exhibits excellent opacity and light-fastness, resulting in superior overall performance on pressure sensitive vinyls and print treated polyesters. It is the responsibility of the user to pretest all substrates with Norcote products prior to use in production.
Not recommended for vinyl with high plasticizer (e.g. static cling); five-year outdoor durability contingent on substrate compatibility
Mesh: 355 PW and above for single lamp; 305 PW and above for two lamp UV systems
Stencil: direct or capillary emulsions, UV compatible, 7–10 µm dry thickness
Squeegee: cut or molded 70–90 durometer or multi-durometer polyurethane, UV compatible
Coverage: 3,200–3,600 sq ft per gallon (0.40–0.60 mil film deposit)
Cure: one 300 W/in or two 200 W/in focused medium pressure mercury vapor lamps; 200 mJ/cm² @ 600 mW/cm² for most colors and clear; 300 mJ/cm² @ 600+ mW/cm² for most opaque colors
Thinning: up to 10% UVO Universal Thinner or 5–10% 1500-049 Mixing Clear; do not microwave
Non-visual post-curing; cross-linking up to 24 hours; cross hatch tape test (3M 600) after exiting cure unit and cooling
1500-C1094 Sunblock Clear recommended to increase outdoor durability and light-fastness
Metallics: 1500-011 Metallic Mixing Clear; mesh 195–305 pw generally recommended for metallic pigment transfer
Fluorescent colors and T-Powders available on request (not light-fast beyond 60–90 days); 230–260 plain weave mesh recommended
Clean-up: conventional solvent; avoid alcohol. Norcote Press Wash 110, 140, or NSW-824

Standard warranty: 1 year from date of sale (no additives); 1 month for custom colors containing DayGlo® JZB or T-Powder; custom colors with metallic pastes or intermixed competitor products not warranted
Specialty UV screen inks for decorative, metallic, and special-effect applications. Availability and specifications vary; contact us for technical bulletins and recommendations.
Our UV screen printing ink series from Norcote International. Each series is designed for specific applications and substrates. More ink types will be added in the future.
